item.title: Pandiculations
item.description: then and now 2017 â€“ No formal yoga practice and obviously not scared of touching the floor in a random place in Mexico 2020 â€“ Ashtanga Quarantine practice in my dark room pandiculation (noun) â€“ a stretching and stiffening especially of the trunk and extremities Merriam Webster

item.title: PapaÃ±ca
item.description: PapaÃ±ca is the Pali term used to describe the tendency of the mind to spread out from and elaborate upon any sense object that arises in experience, smothering it with wave after wave of mental elaboration, most of which is illusory, repetitive, and even obsessive, which effectively blocks any sort of mental calm or clarity of mind. Lionâ€™s Roar Website This was my intended name for the blog, I end up choosing Addhana

item.title: Micaism
[fil-a-vuh-ri]
item.description: Philavery = an idiosyncratic collection of uncommon and pleasing words. I encountered Foyleâ€™s Philavery, a little flowered covered book with red spines, while I was working at a bookshop a couple of years ago. The term stick with me so much that I used it as the tittle of my lists of new words in every journal since then. Hereâ€™s a small recollection of my last added words:
